Articles.Content:
Story: During World War 2 Germany built aircraft that it was basicly a Foker-Wolf fighter lached to a moddifided Junkers medium bomber filled with explosives the fighter guided the Junkers towared a target it then detached it self and the bomber glided down and hit the target and exploded. Your job is to recreate this plane. NOTE i cant remember what it is called so i dont have a wiki page for it

Rules:

1. STOCK parts

2. Must have target

3. Fighter has to return safely

4. Must have pics of takeoff,in air,detachment,target hit,and landing

5. HAVE FUN!!!!

if i find out what it is called i will add the wiki page

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mistel

That is what you are looking for. The challenge seems like it'd be difficult for even some experienced pilots (though I am an inexperienced pilot, so maybe it's me), and I know they are difficult to use from IL-2 experience.

EDIT: Ninja'd

Edited September 7, 2012 by Arkbird
Hmm, type "wunderwaffen" in wikipedia and it comes up with all the cool things Germany made during WW2 including all their experimental aircraft. Many of those seem appealing to make too.
I belive that this fits the bill of Wunderwaffe:

thanks to all who helped i will put up a link to it now

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mistel
